definition: to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)

sentences.english: The tide has obliterated the footprints on the sand.
sentences.chinese: 潮水湮没了沙上的足迹。

sentences.english: He was approaching the inglorious twilight of his career.
sentences.chinese: 他正接近自己的生涯中湮没无闻的隐晦时期。

sentences.english: Fall flowers submerged, buried once they wind ripple.
He was written off as a has-been.
sentences.chinese: 作为曾经是红极一时的人物，他现已湮没无闻。

sentences.english: Who has submerged the fireplace with coom ?
sentences.chinese: 谁用煤炭的灰湮没了壁炉香？

sentences.english: Dickinson's name remained in eclipse for many years after her death.
sentences.chinese: 迪金森死后很多年，她的名字一直都湮没无闻。

sentences.english: After the Han Dynasty, Mohism fell into oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 墨家在汉代以后湮没无闻。

sentences.english: His linguistic work presented much data on languages which would otherwise have been little known.
sentences.chinese: 若非他的语言学着作，众多语言资料仍湮没无闻。

sentences.english: He flees, and walks alone upon the land of to become, lost in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 他逃跑了，然后行走在大地之上，湮没在荒野之中。

sentences.english: Most of his inventions have been consigned to oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部份发明都湮没无闻了。

sentences.english: Leave a piece of pure land, at that time, doomed to oblivion the audacity of commitments.
sentences.chinese: 不留一片净土，那个时代，注定要湮没无畏的追梦者。

sentences.english: We know that on the works of Huang's study had more than Oblivion or incomplete.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道，关于黄老之学的著作多已湮没或残缺。

sentences.english: The blue emotions of the ancients has drowned over time as the past clouds and mist.
sentences.chinese: 古人的苍凉情怀如过眼云烟，留在了湮没的时光里。

sentences.english: A photomagnetic positronium annihilation model was proposed to explain the experimental facts.
sentences.chinese: 提出正电子素光磁湮没模型以解释实验事实。

sentences.english: With its destruction carthaginian civilization fell into oblivion in the history.
sentences.chinese: 迦太基则随着它的灭亡，文明也湮没于历史长河之中。

sentences.english: His name was buried in small print at the end of the book.
sentences.chinese: 他的名字被湮没于书末的小印刷字体中。

definition: to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to sink into oblivion/to be lost to memory/to vanish
to vanish gradually/to disappear/to fade out
to engulf/to bury/to overlook/to stifle/to neglect/to fall into oblivion
a powerful current/a flood (often fig., e.g. a flood of ideas)
to fade into the distance/(fig.) to peter out/to fade away
